p: Camphene is an organic chemical that is known to have a pungent smell; it works effectively in the treatment of fungal skin infections, dysentery, and foot and skin infections; it also treats bacterial, fungal, and viral infections that affect the respiratory system, it completely treats congestion, and it has also been used to treat acute respiratory disorders such as bronchitis [ 22]. It also works with vitamin C as an antioxidant and helps repair damage caused by stress [ 13]. These compounds work together and influence a calming effect on nerves, reducing blood pressure, inflammation, and stress [ 23, 24]. In the studied sample, the content of this compound, was found to range between 12.78% and 14.88%, where its high percentage value was found in leaves during the flowering stage.
